name: Humayun's Tomb
content: Humayun's Tomb was built in 1570 by Empress Bega Begum. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is considered a precursor to the Taj Mahal, combining Persian and Indian architectural styles.

name: Qutub Minar
content: Qutub Minar was started in 1193 by Qutub-ud-din Aibak. It is 73 meters tall and built of red sandstone. The Iron Pillar nearby has not rusted for over 1600 years.

name: Red Fort
content: The Red Fort was constructed in 1648 by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan. Built from red sandstone, it served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Connaught Place
content: Connaught Place was developed in the 1930s as a commercial center of New Delhi. Designed by Robert Tor Russell, it is known for its Georgian-style architecture and radial layout.

name: Lotus Temple
